Connecting.Name: S.S. Tidal
Connecting.Location: Lilycove City,Slateport City,Southern Island,Navel Rock,Birth Island,Faraway Island,Battle Frontier

Connecting.Name: Plasma Frigate
Connecting.Location: Prime Pier,Pokémon World Tournament,Opelucid City,Route 21,Giant Chasm,P2 Laboratory

Description.Description: A lush, green town that is peacefully populated by old former ace trainers.
A lush, green town of senior citizens where there is a relic honoring Celebi.
A sinister and menacing laboratory that was built in the desert without notice.
A secret lab run by the criminal syndicate Cipher to study and develop Shadow Pokémon.
A place of challenging training for all trainers. It is currently held by a sinister gang.
A place for Pokémon battle training that is always open to all trainer challenges.
A Colosseum in the desert that is known only among the elite.
A lonely gasoline stand in a desolate desert. Travelers visit it on their journeys.
A gorgeous jewel of a town that overflows with water in a forbidding desert.
A rough and dirty town full of thugs and scoundrels. It is said to be home to sinister Pokémon.
An honorable town of thugs and scoundrels where Shadow Pokémon were once distributed.
The construction site for an immense tower, which will have a Colosseum on the top floor.
An immense tower that was finally completed as Cipher's base. It has a Colosseum on top.
An immense tower that was finally completed. It is said to have a suspended Colosseum.
The former base of Team Snagem that was completely destroyed in a catastrophic explosion.
A wholly lawless underground town that is ruled by the criminal syndicate Cipher.
An underground town freed of Cipher, and where the Kid Network is now active.
This island has been known by this name since the distant past. No one today knows where it got this name, however.
A forest on a small islet off the coast of Three Island. Berries grow wildly in profusion, quickly replenishing those that fall off.
A mysterious cave that is filled with terribly tough Pokémon. It is so dangerous, the Pokémon League is in charge of it.
A seemingly plain tunnel that was dug by wild Diglett. It is famous for connecting Routes 2 and 11.
A power plant that was abandoned years ago, though some of the machines still work. It is infested with electric Pokémon.
An amusement park outside Fuchsia City where many rare Pokémon can be observed in the wild. Catch them in a popular game!
A bewildering cave off the coast of Resort Gorgeous. Some curious thrill seekers have never emerged from it.
A mystical mountain that is known for its frequent meteor falls. The shards of stars that fall here are known as Moon Stones.
A decrepit, burned-down mansion on Cinnabar Island. It got its name because a famous Pokémon researcher lived there.
A tower that houses the graves of countless Pokémon. Many people visit it daily to pay their respects to the fallen.
A naturally formed underground tunnel. Because it has not been developed, it is inky dark inside. A light is needed to get through.
A pair of islands that is situated on Route 20. The two islands are shaped the same, as if they were twins.
An ancient ruin that is rumored to be home to a peculiar Pokémon. However, so far, the Pokémon remains an unconfirmed rumor.
A tunnel situated on Route 23. It earned its name because it must be traveled by all Trainers aiming for the top.
A deep and sprawling forest that extends around Viridian City. A natural maze, many people become lost inside.
A lush green town of senior citizens. There is a relic honoring Celebi here.
It appears to be a building. Does it have any ties to Cipher?
A factory secretly made by Cipher. Shadow Pokémon links may exist.
The Shadow Pokémon factory that was wrecked by <player>.
A volcanic island ringed by magma.
A lively seaport with active trade. Loitering sailors are a common sight.
The peculiar manor that is home to the eccentric scientist Dr. Kaminko.
A place for Pokémon battle training that is always open to Trainers.
A Colosseum in the desert that is known only among the elite.
A lonely gas station in the desert. Travelers stop by on their journeys.
A gorgeous, oasis-like city that is targeted by Cipher.
A gorgeous city in the desert that overflows with bounteous water.
A rough and rocky Poké Spot where wild Pokémon appear.
A lush, oasis-like Poké Spot where wild Pokémon appear.
A dark and damp Poké Spot where wild Pokémon appear.
The Orre Region's top research lab that studies Pokémon comprehensively.
A noble town of rogues and ruffians. Prof. Krane's friends live here.
A noble town of rogues and ruffians. The high-tech ONBS Building is here.
A noble town of rogues and ruffians. The Cipher-fighting ONBS is here.
An immense, members-only tower that is jam-packed with entertainment.XD
The missing Pokémon cargo ship. Did Cipher transport it here?
Team Snagem's base is apparently still in use even after it was destroyed.
The base where Team Snagem dreams of regaining its former glory.
One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.
The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon.
The Battle Tower—where the best of the best Trainers gather to test their skill—is located here.
A port city that is bisected by a canal. It has a distinctly exotic air of foreign culture.
Head to the library if you want a workout for the mind. Head to the Gym if you just want to work out.
Large ships can always be seen moored at the town's piers.
A tiny town that preserves the history of Sinnoh and the old ways of life.
In the center of the town is a small shrine that dates to ancient times.
An old city that shows fading and almost-forgotten vestiges of ancient history.
A Gym is indispensable in any town that has many people coming and going. This city is no exception.
The Cycle Shop is located here. There is also a big building with a slightly sinister atmosphere.
A statue of an ancient Pokémon is prominently and reverently displayed.
A forest enveloped in chilly air. Thick stands of trees turn the forest into a natural maze.
Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau. It is falling into disrepair after being abandoned by its owner.
A tiny port town where Trainers who love battling more than eating gather.
The gateway to the Battle Park is located here.
Moored at the pier is the ferry to Snowpoint City.
A town of flower lovers, Floaroma Town is always perfumed with the sweet scent of flowers.
A short, floral pathway opens up to a sprawling sea of flowers in bloom.
In the center of town is the flower shop called Pick a Peck of Colors.
A speck of an island far from any civilization. It is covered in an abundance of flowers.
The sprawling ironworks is located with the forest at its back.
The ironworks refines iron ore mined from Mt. Coronet to make iron and to manufacture mechanical parts.
A small, crescent-shaped pond that lies inside a closed-off forest.
This friendly city started as a place where people and Pokémon gathered, then grew into a center of commerce.
If you care about the looks of your Pokémon, head for the Contest Hall. For toughness, go to the Gym.
The entrance to Amity Square is here. The square is a place where Trainers can stroll peacefully with Pokémon.
There is a building here that is symbolic of the city's status as a place where different cultures meet.
A nice fountain with benches, as well as the Pokémon Fan Club, are among the city's amenities.
A small, ore-rich island that is off the coast of Eterna City.
Inside the island are remnants of an iron ore mining operation from the past.
The most modernized city in the Sinnoh region. It is bustling with people on the go.
The Pokétch Company, the developer and manufacturer of the Pokétch, is located here.
Jubilife TV, Sinnoh's TV network, is located here. It is an entertaining place to visit.
The Global Trade Station—GTS for short—is located here.
Located here is the Trainers' School. Drop in to study up on the basics of Pokémon.
One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh region. There is an odd legend associated with it. It is possible to enter the cave underneath the lake from the island in the middle.
A sacred mountain that is capped the year round with snow. A gigantic maze sprawls inside it.
There is an ancient ruin named the Spear Pillar located here.
A small, round pond that lies inside a closed-off forest.
Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau. It is falling into disrepair after being abandoned by its owner.
A vibrant and energetic mining town that is blessed with a precious natural resource.
There is a Gym where mine workers take breaks in between their exhausting work shifts.
There is a museum that specializes in exhibits related to the town's coal mine.
Huge deposits of coal still sleep underneath the ground. The entrance to the Oreburgh Mine is here.
Once one gets through the tunnel, the city of Oreburgh is just a stone's throw away.
This used to be the location of the Safari Zone, but is now the Pal Park.HGSS
This city was originally founded to protect the Great Marsh. It has grown naturally over the years.
The Gym is a good example of the abundant water resources available to the city.
There is a lookout that affords views of the Great Marsh. The gates to the Safari Zone are also here.
Trainers seeking to become the best arrive here after enduring a long and grueling journey.
Victory Road is the last and toughest of the challenges leading up to the Pokémon League.
The Pokémon League reception counter is located here. Only those who have beaten all the Gyms may enter.
A city that attracts Trainers who know there are other ways of enjoying Pokémon than battling.
A sandy town that is located right next to a beach. It is redolent with the salty scent of the sea.
Prof. Rowan's lab is the town's landmark. He conducts his studies on Pokémon here.
A straight path bounded by the sea on both sides. It leads to the Flower Paradise.
The fourth lake of Sinnoh that was kept secret. Beneath the lake's surface is a cave where dimensions are distorted.
A small path through a lush, green, wooded area. The densely grown trees give off a thick aroma.
A winding path that twists through grassy fields. Young Trainers like to test their battle skills here.
Despite being so close to a big town, this path retains its relaxed, natural atmosphere.
Once one gets through the tunnel, the city of Oreburgh is just a stone's throw away.
A charming natural path that wanders past many ponds and groves of trees.
The Ravaged Path was hewn through a rocky outcropping. It is a shortcut that leads straight to Floaroma Town.
A quietly following stream and hilly terrain with one-way ledges make this a fun area for adventure.
Near the entrance of the Eterna Forest is a cabin whose keepers offer rest to weary travelers that stop by.
A wide, wooden walkway spans a large pond. Fishermen idle their time away dangling lines from the walkway.
Smoothly paved in asphalt, the Cycling Road is heavenly for bicycle lovers.
Below the Cycling Road, one can see the entrance to Wayward Cave.
Located at the foot of Mt. Coronet, this road is carved into the rugged, rocky terrain.
A lush field of grass spreads from Mt. Coronet's sheer rock face, creating a vista of contrasts.
The Berry Master, an old man who loves nature, Pokémon, and Berries, makes his home here.
The streams forded by this path wind past copses and grassy patches in a serene and soothing manner.
The Lost Tower is where Pokémon are laid to rest when their lives come to an end.
This narrow route is lined with deep, tall grass that tickles the noses of people straying off the path.
The Cafe Cabin stands in a wood. The house special is freshly milked Moomoo Milk.
A path made by clearing an overgrown canyon between mountains. It is always shrouded by a dense fog.
Grandma Wilma's house stands alone in an isolated spot deep among the mountains.
A mountain path that tunnels through Mt. Coronet, one of the tallest mountains in Sinnoh.
A tall, sturdy wall surrounds an expansive estate that takes up nearly half of the road space.
Beyond the wall, one can see the stately Pokémon Mansion and the owner's prized garden behind it.
This path weaves among deep puddles made by the unending rainfall. It is wet and miserable for Trainers.
There is a house here whose residents offer to trade TMs for Red, Blue, Yellow, or Green Shards.
Offshore boulders form a jetty that becalms waves reaching the beach. A resort hotel overlooks the water.
In a small house on the beach lives a single man who refers to himself as Dr. Footstep.
The road joining Veilstone City and a lake is described as either wildly natural or simply a mess.
This area is always inundated by heavy rainfall. Only hardy Trainers that can take the rain gather here.
This mountainous road leads from Mt. Coronet. Its constant snowfall and deep snowdrifts impede travelers.
Snow blows down from Mt. Coronet and grows into a harsh, ceaseless blizzard. Be prepared for the worst.
Despite its shortness, this road is revered by fishing enthusiasts as a great, yet little known, fishing spot.
A beautiful white-sand beach only five seconds on foot from Sandgem Town. A pleasant breeze flows from the sea.
The sea here is perfect for swimming, with gentle winds and tides. There are sandbars for resting too.
A straight path hemmed by green grass and sparse stands of trees.
At the end of the path stands the gateway to Pal Park.
A sandy beach extends from the road. The beach is busy with avid Fishermen happily casting at the water's edge.
A man who loves fishing lives near here. There is also a man who will compare sizes of caught fish.
A marine route that requires travelers to navigate around jutting rocks and sandbars.
With grass fields, rocky outcroppings, the sea, and sandbars, this area is like a miniature of the Sinnoh Region.
The path makes its way up and down among rocky outcroppings. It is physically challenging.
A path that winds precariously along sheer cliffs that go right to the edge of the sea's pounding waves.
There is a small island in the bay. An odd man who speaks foreign languages lives there.
A rugged and steep mountain path where vision is limited by steadily falling volcanic ash.
This rough path is harshly raked by a horizontally blowing sandstorm driven by strong winds off the sea.
A seaside path that makes its way through wildly growing trees and plants.
A sea route that stretches from west to east. There is an island that is rich with plant life along the way.
A winter wonderland of a city where stout trees and buildings are blanketed in thick snow.
The Gym is at the heart of the city. To the north is the Snowpoint Temple.
The temperate climate makes this town a relaxed and casual place for people and Pokémon to live in.
There is a Pokémon Day Care and a Pokémon Center here.
Beyond a path hemmed by stands of trees, one can find the entrance to the Solaceon Ruins.
The fourth lake of Sinnoh that was kept secret.
Beneath the lake's surface is a cave where dimensions are distorted.
A rugged, seemingly indestructible rock mountain that is thickly blanketed by the volcanic ash it spews.
Inside the mountain, fissures in spilled and hardened lava form enormous caverns.
A port city that was built around the bay portion of the cape. It is criss-crossed by elevated walkways.
The Gym is located atop a rocky outcropping. Down on the beach is a festive bazaar.
The Vista Lighthouse's bright beacon illuminates the Sinnoh region.
A city where hot-blooded Trainers gather to work out and hone their battling skills.
A small town with the fresh scent of new leaves in the air. It feels like a place where adventures start.
Your own home and your best friend's house are located here.
Numerous wind turbines stand in the vicinity of the Valley Windworks. Winds blowing through the canyon feed the wind turbines to generate clean electricity.
One of the lakes that is symbolic of the water-rich Sinnoh Region. There is an odd legend associated with it. A high-class restaurant is located on a hill overlooking the lake.
This city was made by carving out steep, rocky mountains. Its isolation limits its contact with other cities.
The city puts effort into providing entertainment. Naturally, one can find a Gym here.
Conveniently located right next door to the Game Corner is the Prize Exchange.
At the highest point in the city is Team Galactic's headquarters.
There are warehouses for storing a variety of goods. There is also a major department store.

A town where people and Pokémon live together in simple harmony.
A place where people from all over come to show off their strength.
A tower that's said to have a legendary Pokémon that lands there.
A path said to always be bathed in sunset, no matter what the season.
A mysterious mountain village cut into a rock face.
A tower that was hit by lightning, and subsequently caught fire and burned.
A rich, rainbow colored city where people and Pokémon gather.
A cave that had collapsed once. It has been reconstructed.
A beautiful city with flowing water and blooming flowers.
A city where you can smell small flowers and a sea breeze.
A beachside city that has benefitted greatly from the sea.
A town used to be here until it was swept away by an eruption.
A dark, difficult-to-navigate tunnel that runs beneath the Johto region.
A tunnel dug by Diglett connecting Vermilion City to Pewter City.
A city that even now bears the marks of its history.
A place where people from all over come to show off their strength.
A historic village that has become new.
It shines brightly over the ocean with the power of Ampharos.
A developing city where people and Pokémon come and go as they like.
A cave that connects Route 44 to Blackthorn City.
A large forest full of trees that are used to make charcoal.
The fate of many Trainers aiming for the top rests here.
A road that begins a journey. The road smells like freshly cut grass.
A grassy path where you can battle other young Trainers.
A short, nostalgic path winding through nature.
A path crossed by the Magnet Train bridge--nature meets technology.
A difficult and always rainy path that comes out in a cave.
A lush, green path, even though it's right next to a city.
A bright path with a lake that's easy on the eyes and easy to traverse.
A green and densely overgrown path that forks in two directions.
A popular route for Trainers, marked by three Apricorn trees.
A path that weaves through trees and comes out at a farm.
A downhill path that passes through a grassy and breezy plain.
You can hear the waves on this path from west Olivine City to the sea.
A rough spot in the sea where whirlpools block your path.
A small path opened at the base of challenging Mt. Mortar with multiple entrances to it.
A woodland path that comes out at a lake. Beware the greedy gate.
A wonderful path with a few pleasant springs and abundant greenery.
A winding road by a river, but called Mountain Road.
A way home that runs from the base of the mountains to the plains.
A road on a cliff that strikes fear in the hearts of those who dare to pass.
A pleasant path from the base of the mountain to the Safari Zone.
The plant that generates all the energy for the Kanto region.
A country road full of greenery and rough paths.
A road that passes along the canal and comes out at the Power Plant.
A grassy path with a gentle, refreshing breeze.
A bridge known for its fishing. It's also called Silence Bridge.
A difficult, narrow path where many Trainers await you.
A pleasant coastal road where the breeze blows and waves roar.
A path that cuts through the row of trees to come out on the coastline.
The northern starting point of Cycling Road.
An easy path of Cycling Road running above the sea.
The southern ending point of Cycling Road.
A coastal road littered with rocks due to Cinnabar Island's volcano eruption.
A path that winds and bends from the forest's entrance.
A popular path with swimmers. The Seafoam Islands are also here.
A coastal road where the only threat might be the volcano on the horizon.
A path to Victory Road that eventually becomes impassable.
A beautiful bridge that stretches across a river.
A path that winds through the forest and comes out overlooking the sea.
An unimaginably difficult mountain road that gives the impression of a test.
A road that crosses from Johto to the Kanto region, like a new journey.

The deep blue ocean off Kalos's coast, where Pokémon from distant lands are said to visit.
This ancient town was once famous for the long-neglected manor home of a noble family.
A mysterious void. It is said that nothing can exist within it.
This cave linking Route 7 and Cyllage City is notable for its great hordes of Zubat.
An exclusive resort area made popular thanks to its clear skies and mild atmosphere.
The railway brings people from great distances to see the huge, majestic falls.
A city nestled between the cliffs and the sea, overlooked by steep Bicycle racecourses.
A rural town where Pokémon and windmills work together to farm the land in a chilly latitude.
The drifting snow and impenetrable fog make this cavern a place of fantastical illusions.
A town lined with mysterious stones and encircled by strange ruins of old.
Lose all sense of direction as you wander though this cave, where Luminous Moss glows emerald green.
An environmentally responsible power plant that generates solar power from space.
A small and quiet country lane that connects Vaniville Town and Aquacorde Town.
Countless stones line this mysterious path in such numbers and arrays that it seems overwhelming.
One can feel the power of the earth's interior from the crystals that sprout along this mountain path.
Frolicking Skiddo can be seen and ridden at the Baa de Mer Ranch, located beside the breezy sea.
Since no plants can grow in the red clay of this great plain, it hosts the Power Plant instead.
The lush trees and boggy swamps of this trail give off an eerie vibe, even in broad daylight.
This path has become a popular hangout for the wild and directionless youths of Lumiose City.
This rustic path beside the glittering metropolis of Lumiose City is a well-known fishing spot.
Due to constant snowstorms and heavy snowfall, humans have no hope of traversing this road on foot.
This path is best known for its trolley, once used for the coal mine, and the curious Inverse Battle house.
This great valley can now be crossed thanks to its long bridge, built with the help of many Pokémon.
You'll find many Pokémon hiding among the tall grass that grows in tufts along this trail.
This path was designed to disturb the woods as little as possible, so it twists and turns among the trees.
This is the path of the chosen, designed to hone the stalwart Trainers who dare face the Pokémon League.
This lively path bustles with many Trainers and their Pokémon, all gathered here to train themselves.
The little rises and hollows of this lush forest are a favorite place for many kinds of Pokémon to play.
This famed path's perfectly designed and executed gardens are its highlight and a special point of pride.
Roller Skaters from across the Kalos region gather on this hilly path to demonstrate their best skills.
This tree-lined path was once covered with grass as tall as a man, but it was cleared by the palace.
The longest single road in the Kalos region runs straight alongside one of its greatest rivers.
This is a road of great contrasts, from the harsh rock of the cliffs to the soft sands of the beach.
This rocky passage was created by retired Rhyhorn racers who forged a path where there was none.
This city, popular with Pokémon Trainers, is a typical example of southern Kalosian life.
An unearthly city created by those inspired by a mysterious and ancient tree 1,500 years old.
This once-famous hotel clings to the shade of its former glory after tragedy left it in ruins.
A dazzling metropolis of art and artifice, located in the very heart of the Kalos region.
A luxurious palace constructed 300 years ago by a king who wished to display his power to all.
An expansive factory where every Poké Ball used in the Kalos region is produced.
This path is open only to those who can best every Pokémon Gym in the Kalos region.
Legends say a place exists where Pokémon live in hiding, but no one has ever found it.
The sheer faces of these rock walls reflect the images of people and Pokémon like nature's mirror.
Many beginning Trainers gather in this friendly city to start a Pokémon journey.
The gentle light filtering through this sun-dappled forest makes it a popular spot for nature walks.
A pit in the shallows of Azure Bay thought to have been from an ancient outpouring of energy.
The seaside home of the Tower of Mastery, where the legend of mysterious stones lives on.
They say the cold air flowing from the Pokémon Gym is responsible for this city's frozen state.
The base of Team Flare's operations, built in secret to activate the ultimate weapon.
A coal mine that was closed a few years ago due to rumors of a monster living deep within it.
Blooming buds covered in morning dew exude hope for the future in this small town.
This treacherous path to the Pokémon League will break the hearts of even the toughest Trainers.
This grand resort was built with the aim of allowing Trainers to enjoy every kind of Pokémon battle.
A long-sleeping Pokémon will descend upon this cavern in order to awaken its true powers.
New trends are always the rage among the inhabitants of this small island town.
Ever Grande City: This city is blanketed in a profusion of colorful blooms. It plays host to the grand Pokémon League.
A town formed by scholars who gather to research meteorites.
The Pokémon that live in this area like to use the steam that erupts from the ground as a sort of bath.
The people and the Pokémon of this city follow nature's cues to rise each morning and end each day.
This cavern is famous for its cave art, which depicts events from thousands of years ago.
This grassy path running between Littleroot Town and Oldale Town is perfect for doing fieldwork.
Many Trainers gather on this route in the hope of encountering Pokémon in the wild.
On weekends and holidays, fishing enthusiasts flock to every section of coastline on this seaside route.
This path, rich with water and colorful plant life, runs north and south of Petalburg Woods.
This water route boasts gentle currents, which makes it safe for even poor swimmers to bask in.
This is the site of serious battles between Fishermen of the seaside area and the wild Pokémon of the seas.
The local children of Dewford Town practice long-distance swimming in the waters of this aquatic route.
People come swimming from as far away as the Kalos region to see the site of Sea Mauville.
People and Pokémon alike enjoy ocean swims in this water route.
A timeworn path where nature remains untouched. Above it on this route stretches the huge Cycling Road.
This expansive route includes a desert where sandstorms rage unceasingly and a mountain pass.
This route is popular among Trainers because it offers the chance to stroll while gazing up at Mt. Chimney.
The tall grass on this route is painted a dusty gray by the volcanic ash that pours from Mt. Chimney.
This mountain path to Meteor Falls is so long and arduous that even Hikers have difficulty tackling it.
This trail to Rustboro City was broken by people who lived at Meteor Falls long ago.
A path that many workers take on their daily commute between Rustboro City and Rusturf Tunnel.
A path where many Trainers gather to raise their Pokémon and train them for battle.
This seaside route brings together the east and west sides of the Hoenn region.
If you are not prepared for it, the harsh conditions of this tropical rain forest will defeat you in less than five minutes.
Pokémon that can camouflage themselves hide in the rich wilds along this route.
This road leads to both the Safari Zone and Mt. Pyre. Many people set out along this route from Lilycove City.
People make their way to Mt. Pyre over this water route, reliving many precious memories as they traverse it.
This route offers a convenient path back to Mauville City from Mt. Pyre, but be aware that it is a one-way road.
This great stretch of ocean connects the cities of Lilycove, Mossdeep, and Sootopolis.
Small children are allowed to play in the waters of this sea route as far as Shoal Cave—but no further!
Even a pro swimmer would need three entire days to circuit around the crater containing Sootopolis City.
With no place to stop and rest in these waters, it is very hard for a swimmer to make it across this route.
The ocean floor beneath this water route is rumored to contain an undiscovered ruin.
Many Pokémon Trainers visit this route to train their Pokémon before challenging the Pokémon League.
This route was once a big topic of conversation due to a strange island that seemed to appear and then disappear.
It is the custom in Pacifidlog Town to swim a lap around this route before breakfast.
Trainers gather in this stretch of sea in search of something beyond its fierce currents.
This route is rather a famous diving spot among those who love exploring ancient ruins.
This amusement area provides a rich environment in which to catch many different kinds of Pokémon.
This mountain route is the result of a volcanic eruption in ages long past. It can only be traversed on an Acro Bike.
A popular spot in the Hoenn region, thanks to its hot springs, said to cure any ailment.
This tourist destination is undergoing a revival, thanks to the popularity of its Pokémon Contest Spectaculars.
Basking amid vibrant nature, this simple town is not shaded with any one hue.
This large city is located in the heart of the Hoenn region, at the crossroads of its nostalgic past and new technology.
This waterfall is said to have been the site of a meteor shower. An ancient people once made their home here.
Research is underway day and night in this city, all in the hope of understanding the distant reaches of space.
This volcano towers to a height of nearly 5,000 feet. The view from its peak is beyond compare.
The mountain is where spirits of Pokémon have rested and will always rest: past, present, and future.
Though it was planned to be a subterranean city extending 69 floors underground, this project died in development.
A town where the contrast between colorful flowers and deep, verdant forests is most beautiful.
This town first came into being as a floating storehouse used by people living on the ocean's surface.
A whiff of salt is always in the air in this city, which is skirted by the ocean shore.
This dense forest, with its abundance of trees, is well known to be a favorite habitat for Shroomish.
A revered site that can only be visited by those Trainers who have dominated every last Pokémon Gym.
This city is the main hub of industry in the Hoenn region, with the Devon Corporation as its beating heart.
This stone tunnel links together Rustboro and Verdanturf. Its name was chosen as a mixture of the two.
A facility that was decommissioned dozens of years ago. It is now maintained as a natural preserve.
It is said that a Pokémon once dwelled here in the ancient mists of a time long past.
There is a large tree on this little island that would be ideal for making a Secret Base.
There are many small caves in this meadow that would be ideal for making Secret Bases.
There are many small caves along this shore that would be ideal for making Secret Bases.
This cave's appearance changes greatly between high tide and low tide.
This tower was created for the veneration of a Legendary Pokémon that lives far above in the heavens.
People from many different regions gather and mingle in this bustling port city.
This city, which rises from the crater of a great meteoroid crash, can only be reached through the sea or from the sky.
This small island is surrounded by a mysterious veil that makes approach impossible for mere humans.
Thanks to the prevailing wind pattern, this town is always kept clear of falling volcanic ash.
This challenging path forces Trainers who hope to overcome the Pokémon League to first surpass their own limits.
A VLFS or a very large floating structure. This is where the Aether Foundation's research facilities are.
A grassy stretch along Akala's southern-most coast. It leads from Memorial Hill to the Ruins of Life.
A grassy stretch along Akala's southern-most coast. It leads from Memorial Hill to the Ru
This beautiful path filled with flora connects Iki Town at its north end to Hau'oli City in the south.
An area located between Hau'oli City and Route 1. You can catch a whiff of salt on the southerly winds.
Description.Title: Hau'oli Outskirts

Description.Description: A gladed path filled with the nests of many Pokémon. It leads to the road that can take you to the top of Mount Hokulani.
One of the routes that connects Malie City with the nature surrounding it. This one leads to a rough mountain trail.
A route full of rugged boulders that present a difficult challenge to anyone who hopes to pass through it.
A route considered by many to be a place to take a break before taking on Haina Desert.
An old route that leads to a trial site. Its beach is famous for its unique black sand.
A water route that lies on the western coast of Ula'ula Island. People often rely on Pokémon to traverse it.
Trainers all take a little break at the Pokémon Center here before they proceed to Ula'ula Meadow.
The rain never stops falling in sheets on this route. This path always seems to inspire a sense of unease.
A path that leads to the northern part of Melemele Island. It's famous for being a training ground for the local Trainers.
A steep mountain path surrounded by rocks where a lot of bird Pokémon live.
A route that connects Heahea City and Paniola Town. The gentle touch of nature is abundant here.
A winding route with many branching paths and ledges. It is quite challenging for people traveling on foot.
A plain and straight route that leads through the middle of Akala Island. It is also known by the name Straight Street.
A route that takes you to Wela Volcano Park. It makes anyone sweat from the heat of the volcano.
An oceanside route with great views. It is a popular date spot enjoyed by many couples and Pokémon.
A short route constructed by the local Diglett with whatever strength they had remaining after digging Diglett's Tunnel.
An altar that is said to be closely associated with the Legendary Pokémon depicted in the local folklore.
An altar that is said to be closely associated with the Legendary Pokémon depicted in the local folklore.
An old path that leads to Vast Poni Canyon. Some people and Pokémon still try to live in the ruins here, but not many.
The sacred battle grounds for the toughest Trainers of the Alola region.
A Berry field with soft soil. It is the pride and joy of the local Berry master.
The mountain where the Geothermal Power Plant is situated. Its output covers almost all of Ula'ula Island's electric needs.
The best fishing spot in the Alola region. Its series of cascading waterfalls make it look like a terrace field.
Diglett and people worked together to finish digging this tunnel several years ago.
It's a paradise for Exeggutor! This island is designated as a special preserve.
A scorching-hot desert beyond Route 13. Trainers often get lost here in this broiling labyrinth.
The beach near Hano Grand Hotel at the Hano Grand Resort. Pyukumuku-chucking is a popular part-time job to do here.
The biggest of all the resorts in the Alola region. The hotel is fully booked a year in advance.
One of the best resorts in the Alola region. Everybody talks about this five-star hotel.
Description.Title: Hano Grand Hotel

Description.Description: The people and Pokémon on Melemele Island share their lives, and here they have also shared their graves for generations.
A popular spot where locals like to gather. Even people from other towns come to Hau'oli City to visit this beach.
Description.Title: Beachfront

Description.Description: The bustling center of the city, where you can get everything from fashion items to popular treats to eat.
Description.Title: Shopping District

Description.Description: A harbor where you can set out for the other islands. It's visited by many people and boats.
Description.Title: Marina

Description.Description: Considered the front door to Akala Island, this town's residents treasure visitors and welcome them most warmly.
A research facility for observing and studying various phenomena in space.
An old town where traditions have been passed on for generations. The villagers here are close with Tapu Koko.
One of the most scenic spots on Melemele Island. It was chosen as one of the top 100 views in Alola.
The large gateway at the entrance gives a unique impression. This is a city of merchants, where you find lots of shops.
A place that seems to have some connection to the Alola's Legendary Pokémon. The lake forms a perfect circle.
A place that seems to have some connection to the Alola's Legendary Pokémon. The lake forms a perfect circle.
A heavily wooded tropical rain forest. It's famous for producing ingredients for delicious meals.
A mountainous trail that leads to the sacred ruins. The cool air up here is very soothing on the skin.
A city with an obvious Eastern influence in its design. The architecture is distinctive here.
A cape famous for its Recycling Plant. The plant is co-managed by people and Pokémon.
Description.Title: Outer Cape

Description.Description: A well-manicured garden located in the middle of Malie City. The large lake within it seems to resemble something...
A place where yellow flowers bloom in abundance. You can gather the nectar Oricorio loves to feed on here.
The sea is crowded with Melemele islanders, local Pokémon, and visiting tourists all year round.

Description.Description: A place where the memories of people and Pokémon linger. Many people come from other islands to visit this graveyard.
A mountain suitable for observing the stars. There is an observatory on top.
The roughest and coldest mountain in the Alola region. A large-scale construction project has been taken up here.
The ranch managed together by the people and Pokémon living in Paniola Town.
A town located in the middle of Akala Island and surrounded by ranch land and pastures for grazing.
A town barricaded with tall walls that seem to reach the sky. It is occupied by Team Skull.
The place where the most powerful Trainer in the Alola region will be decided. Coming soon!
The southern coast of Poni Island, where rough waves pound mercilessly upon the shore.
The north-eastern coast of Poni Island, where the clarity of the water makes it a popular view spot.
A difficult path that leads to the Battle Tree. It's full of tough Trainers.
A natural path that winds among the many trees. It leads to the eastern side of Poni Island.
A place where purple flowers bloom in abundance. You can gather the nectar Oricorio loves to feed on here.
The plains that lead to the northern part of Poni island. There is also a path connecting to Poni Meadow from here.
The entrance to Poni Island. It connects to Seafolk Village.

A major street that has developed so much thanks to the Battle Royal Dome being on it, making it look like a city street.
The ruins that enshrine Tapu Bulu, one of the land spirits. It is said that life grows here.

A placid sloping road connecting to the Underground Path.

A short path connecting Route 8 with the Underground Path.

An uneven road where children often play.
A solemn, quiet town. People come to visit their departed Pokémon.

The stone city that rests at the foot of a great rocky mountain.

A large natural tunnel. It's pitch black, so a light source is required.
Two small islands lightly floating in the ocean. A shocking cold fills the caverns inside.
The international port town where magnificent boats gather from across the world.
A cave that tests Trainers aiming to reach the Pokémon League at the summit.
The nature-loving city where flowers bloom all year round.
A deep, shady forest filled with nature and Bug-type Pokémon.
A charming town where the people make their homes among the trunks of the towering trees.

An industrial city studded with steam-powered marvels of modern engineering.
A farming town since days of old, where people and their Pokémon live in close harmony.
This rocking town has a punk vibe and streets crammed with shops lined up cheek by jowl.
A vibrant town that has grown up around an ancient mural tucked away in the mountains.
A town nestled within the nurturing bowl of our many terraced farming fields.
Our quiet borough is home to the esteemed Pokémon Research Lab.
This booming metropolis was designed and developed by our very own Chairman Rose.
